result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy Sean Hobbs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Posts or Publishes Private Representation w/out Consent, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 942.09(3m)(a)1.
  • Posts or Publishes Private Representation w/out Consent, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 942.09(3m)(a)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Court will allow the defendant's probation to be transferred to the State of North Carolina if accepted.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all costs, fees and surcharges. Failure to pay during period of probation will result in a civil judgment.
Pay DNA surcharge on COUNT 1 & COUNT 2.
Court set restitution at ZERO.

No contact with the victim or her school, place of employment or residence.
Defendant is prohibited from maintaining any social media accounts.

Participate in anger management program.
Any electronic devices must be turned over to agent for inspection upon demand.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Random urine screens.
Provide prescription to the agent before filling the prescription.

timeConds.notes: IMPOSED AND STAYED, to be used at the discretion of the agent.

charges.descr: Posts or Publishes Private Representation w/out Consent

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: Count 1.   Credit for 17 days time served.
If revoked, defendant may have work release if employed at the time of revocation.  Defendant may participate in employment/vocational programming at House of Correction.

records.addlTxt:
Order Amending Judgment Of Conviction - it is hereby ordered that the order to provide a DNA sample is vacated.  The judgment of conviction shall be amended by removing the language "provide a DNA sample" from the comments section - signed by the Court and filed.   Copies mailed to the parties.
Clerk:  jms
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Mark A. Sanders, Br. 28, calendar successor, for review. mag
DOC request to remove order for DNA sample.

As to COUNT 3-
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 3 dismissed but read in for purposes of sentencing.

Defendant Jeremy Sean Hobbs in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. Parties are prepared to proceed. State placed negotiations on the record.
Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNTS 1 & 2-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as to COUNT 1 and COUNT 2.  Judgments of conviction entered.

State requests an adjourned sentencing date for victim notification. Defense does not object. Court granted State's request. Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeremy Sean Hobbs in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Michael Thurston on behalf of Cynthia Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel requests a projected plea date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeremy Sean Hobbs in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for pre-trial conference. Attorney Rebholz previously in court but needed to go to Branch 22 for jury trial. Defense has not received discovery or an offer from the State and requests an adjourned scheduling date. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed. Court ordered defendant to meet with attorney Rebholz prior to the next court date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signature bond that was previously signed remains  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 02-16-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Prior: 5221 North 53rd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53218
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Vici C. and C.J. and the address 5780 N. Port Washington Road

Defendant Jeremy Sean Hobbs in court.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.
Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.25  for a Pretrial Conference.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2/2/15 @ 1:30pm
